text: Long short - term memory memory ( LSTM ) is is an artificial neural neural network network used in the fields of artificial artificial intelligence and deep learning . Unlike standard feedforward neural neural networks , LSTM LSTM has feedback connections . Such a recurrent neural neural network network ( RNN RNN ) can process not only single data points ( such such as images ) , but but also entire sequences of data ( such as speech or or video ) . For example , LSTM LSTM is is applicable to tasks tasks such such as as unsegmented , connected handwriting recognition , speech recognition recognition , machine translation , robot control control , video video games,[10 ] and healthcare.[11 ] The name of LSTM refers to the the analogy that a standard RNN has both " long long - term memory " and " short - term term memory " . The connection connection weights and biases biases in the network change once per per episode of training , analogous to how physiological changes in synaptic synaptic strengths store long - term memories memories ; the the activation patterns in the network change once per time - step , analogous analogous to how the moment - to to - moment change in electric firing patterns in the the brain store short short - term memories.[12 ] The LSTM architecture aims to to provide a short - term term memory for RNN that can last thousands thousands of timesteps , thus thus " long short - term term memory memory " . A common LSTM LSTM unit is composed composed of of a cell , an input input gate , an an output output gate[13 ] and a forget forget gate.[14 ] The cell remembers remembers values over arbitrary time time intervals and the the three gates gates regulate the flow flow of information information into and out of the cell . LSTM networks are well - suited to classifying , processing and making predictions based on time series data , since there can be lags of unknown duration between important important events in a time time series . LSTMs were developed to deal with the the vanishing gradient gradient problem[15 problem[15 ] that can can be encountered when training traditional RNNs RNNs . Relative Relative insensitivity to gap length is an advantage advantage of LSTM over over RNNs , hidden hidden Markov models and and other sequence sequence learning learning methods in numerous applications.[citation needed needed ]

text: Fundamental analysis is a method of evaluating the intrinsic value value of a stock by by examining its financial financial statements statements and other other company - specific factors . One financial metric that is is often often used in fundamental analysis is the the price - to - earnings earnings - to - growth ( PEG ) ratio ratio . The PEG ratio ratio is calculated by dividing dividing the the price price - to - earnings ( P / E ) ratio by the the company company 's expected earnings growth rate . The P / E ratio ratio is is a measure of the price of of a stock stock relative to its its earnings per share . It is is calculated by by dividing the current current market price of the stock stock by the company 's earnings per share ( EPS EPS ) . The PEG ratio is used to evaluate whether a stock stock is is overvalued or undervalued based on on its price and earnings growth . For example , if a company has a P / E ratio of 20 and an expected earnings growth rate of 10 % , its PEG ratio ratio would be 2 . A PEG ratio of less than 1 is generally considered considered undervalued , while a PEG ratio greater than 1 is considered overvalued . There There are several limitations to using using the PEG ratio as a sole measure of a stock 's value value . It It is based based on future future earnings growth estimates , which which are are inherently uncertain and subject to to change change . Additionally , the PEG ratio does not take into into account other factors that can affect affect a company company 's 's value , such such as its debt levels , market conditions conditions , and competitive landscape . It is important to consider a variety of factors when when evaluating a stock and and to to use the PEG PEG ratio as just one tool among many in in your analysis .

text: A ranked voting system is a way of casting casting and and counting votes votes in an election where where voters are able to rank rank the candidates in order of preference preference . Instead of of just choosing one one candidate , voters can can indicate their their top choice , second choice , third choice , and so on . In In a ranked voting voting system system , if if a candidate wins a majority of first - choice choice votes , they are declared declared the winner winner just like in in a normal normal election . If no candidate wins a majority majority of first - choice votes , then then the candidate with with the fewest votes votes is eliminated and their votes are are redistributed to the voters ' next choice . This process process is repeated until until one candidate has has a majority majority of votes votes and is is declared the the winner . One advantage of of ranked voting voting is that it can help ensure that the winner of an election has the support of a majority of of voters voters , rather than than just a plurality of of voters . In In a normal election election , it it is possible for a candidate to win with less than than 50 50 % of the vote if there there are more than two candidates candidates running running . In a ranked voting system , this is less likely to to happen because the votes votes of the least popular candidate can be be redistributed to the voters ' next next choice choice . As As for how a ranked ranked voting system could help eliminate the the two - party system , it 's important to note that ranked voting is just one of of many potential potential reforms that could help help encourage more political diversity . However , ranked voting could potentially help by making it easier for third - party candidates or or independent candidates to win win elections . Since Since voters voters are able able to rank rank multiple candidates candidates in order of preference preference , they can choose to support a third - party candidate as their their first first choice while still expressing expressing a preference for one of the major major party candidates as their second choice . This could could make it more likely that that a third third - party party candidate could win an election , or at at least have have a stronger stronger influence on the outcome .

text: Fractional reserve banking is a type type of banking system system in which banks only hold a fraction of the deposits deposits they receive as reserves , while lending out the rest rest . This means means that that banks can create new money by lending out more more than than they have on deposit . Under a fractional reserve banking system , banks are required to to hold a certain percentage of their deposits as reserves , while the rest rest can be lent out out to borrowers . The The reserve requirement is set set by the central bank , and it can vary depending on the type of deposits and the overall overall economic conditions . However , there is a risk of insolvency in a fractional reserve reserve banking system system if if the demand for withdrawals exceeds the amount amount of reserves held by by the bank bank . If If this happens happens , the the bank may may not have enough cash on hand to meet the demand for withdrawals withdrawals , and it may may have have to borrow borrow from other other banks or the central bank to cover the shortfall . This is is known as as a " bank run run , " and it can lead to a financial financial crisis if it spreads to other banks . To reduce the risk of insolvency , central banks often act act as a lender of of last resort resort , providing providing banks with the cash they need need to to meet the demand demand for withdrawals during a crisis . Central banks also regulate the the banking sector sector to ensure that that banks banks are sufficiently capitalized capitalized and and have have sufficient reserves to weather financial shocks .

This method is often used when when it is difficult or impractical to sample sample from the entire population population , or when the population is is geographically dispersed and it is easier to sample from smaller smaller groups.

Overall , the the main difference between between multistage multistage and and cluster sampling sampling is the the way in in which which the population is divided into smaller units units for sampling . Single malt Scotch Scotch whisky is made made from from water , malted malted barley , and yeast yeast . Here 's the general process for for making making single malt Scotch whisky:

Malting whisky:

Malting : The barley barley is soaked in water and allowed to germinate , or sprout . During this process process , enzymes are produced that will will convert the the starch starch in the barley into sugars . The The germinated barley is then then dried over a peat fire , which which gives it it a distinctive smoky flavor.

Milling flavor.

Milling : The dried malt is ground into into a coarse flour called grist.

Mashing : The The grist is mixed with with hot water in a large large vessel called a mash tun . This process , called mashing , extracts extracts the sugars sugars from from the the malt and and creates a liquid called wort.

Fermentation wort.

Fermentation : The The wort is transferred transferred to a large large vessel called called a washback , where it it is mixed with yeast . The yeast ferments the sugars in the wort , converting them them into alcohol and producing a liquid called wash . The wash has an alcohol content of of about 8 - 9%.

Distillation : The wash is is transferred to a still , where it it is heated until the alcohol alcohol vaporizes vaporizes . The vapor vapor is then then condensed back back into a liquid , resulting resulting in a clear , colorless liquid called low low wine . The low wine is then distilled distilled again , producing a liquid called called spirit.

Aging spirit.

Aging : The spirit is placed in oak oak barrels barrels to to mature . The barrels are are typically typically aged aged for at least least three years , although some single malt malt Scotch whiskies are aged for much much longer . During the aging process , the spirit takes on the color and flavor flavor characteristics of the barrel.

Blending and and bottling bottling : The aged spirit spirit is is typically blended with spirit from other barrels to create a consistent flavor profile . The The blended spirit spirit is is then bottled and and sold as as single malt malt Scotch Scotch whisky.

text: netting netting means to combine cash inflows and outflows ( e.g. debits / credits , payments payments / receipts , income / expense ) by subtracting the the sum of all all outflows from the sum of of all inflows , creating one one transaction . For For example example , if you make two trades in one one day with your your broker - one to buy a security for $ 100 and one to sell it for $ 110 - rather then you sending sending your broker $ 100 100 and them them sending you $ 110 , the the transactions transactions are " netted " - meaning meaning they they will will send send you the " net " amount of $ 10 10 ( $ 110 inflow - $ 100 outflow ) . In In a more general sense ( " netting of instructions " ) it would mean to combine all all instructions instructions and only apply the " net " effect - e.g. one step forward , two steps back would would combine to a " net " one step back . Most likely likely it will apply to the the exchange of of money , but it could be applied applied more broadly . Note that there there does n't have to be both inflows inflows and outflows . You can also " net net " multiple multiple inflows inflows ( or outflows ) into into one transaction by just adding adding them all up , but but typical business usage is is to to reduce the the number of transactions by combining inflows and outflows outflows .
